text:
Michael Strahan sent Ryan Seacrest a bottle of wine when he got the job co-hosting Live alongside Kelly Ripa, it has been revealed.

A year after he jumped ship to join the Good Morning America team the retired NFL player made the kind gesture, according to the former American Idol host.

Seacrest makes the revelation in a new interview with The Hollywood Reporter.

And while Strahan sent him a bottle of wine, Regis Philbin picked up the phone to have a chat after he started the gig last month.

Seacrest said the 85-year-old TV veteran advised him to go out and keep himself busy in the evenings before he headed to work in the morning.

We had so many amazing people throw their hat into the ring, but at a certain point you have to start making a show a show again and it was becoming a reality competition.

“He said to me, 'Ryan, I was most worried about doing something the night before so we had something to talk about in the first 20 minutes of the show, so just make sure you're doing something,’” the new Live With Kelly and Ryan co-host reveals.

Meanwhile Ripa told the Reporter that, after a year of searching for a new TV partner in crime, Seacrest was her first choice.

"He's just so seamless," she said, "that people don't realize that what he does is actually very, very difficult."

The actress had a wide variety of people guest host the show with her while she looked for someone permanent – from actors Fred Savage and Jerry O’Connell to her pals Anderson Cooper and Andy Cohen.

Ripa said: "We had so many amazing people throw their hat into the ring, but at a certain point you have to start making a show a show again and it was becoming a reality competition."

But soon after Seacrest was announced as her new Live co-host it was revealed that he is in negotiations to be the face of American Idol again when the network reboots the show.

There were numerous tabloid reports that Ripa was upset with the prospect of Seacrest pulling double duty and that she feared it would be a repeat of the Strahan saga, which saw the former athlete permanently ditch her for another gig.

But she pours cold water on those rumors, telling the Reporter: "You get a talk show and you're yourself on the air, and people project whatever they want onto you, and there's not a shred of truth to it."

According to the Reporter, Seacrest and ABC are still working on a deal to bring him back to host the talent contest.

And he seems keen on the idea. Seacrest told the industry bible: "I've always loved the show. And if I could do it forever, I would do it forever."
title: How Michael Strahan congratulated Ryan Seacrest on his ‘Live’ job
